title: Are COVID-19 isolation and booze a dangerous mix? Some health experts think so
description: Liquor store sales increased across the country in March as shoppers stocked up to wait out the COVID-19 outbreak. That has some addiction experts warning about the potentially risky mix of packed liquor cabinets, stress, anxiety, and days and weeks stuck at …
content:
Long lines. Shoppers, many of them wearing masks, standing two metres apart.
Is it worth the risk of community interaction during a deadly pandemic just to load up on booze?
The answer for many Canadians, it would seem, is yes.
As with sales of groceries, … [+11970 chars]
